meanings.definition: The act of writing with a stylus.
meanings.sent1: Her stylographies on the tablet were neat and precise.
meanings.sent2: The ancient scribe's stylographies on the clay tablet were well-preserved.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's stylographies on the whiteboard were so clear that even the students at the back could read them.
meanings.sent4: His stylographies on the canvas of life painted a picture of wisdom and experience.
meanings.sent5: The artist's stylographies flowed effortlessly, capturing the essence of the scene.

meanings.sent1: The library displayed various stylographies from different authors.
meanings.sent2: Her stylographies were published in a renowned literary magazine.
meanings.sent3: The detective novel was a thrilling stylography of suspense and mystery.
meanings.sent4: His stylography of poetry was a symphony of emotions and imagery.
meanings.sent5: The historical document was a valuable stylography of past events.

meanings.definition: The study or practice of writing.
meanings.sent1: Her interest in stylographies led her to pursue a degree in literature.
meanings.sent2: The workshop focused on the art of stylographies and storytelling.
meanings.sent3: His dedication to stylographies sometimes kept him up late at night.
meanings.sent4: The professor's passion for stylographies inspired his students to excel.
meanings.sent5: The course covered various aspects of stylographies, from grammar to punctuation.
